title: E field - two particles 2q and -q near point P

content.question: Two particles are located near Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. One particle has charge <math alttext="positive 2 q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> and is a distance <math alttext="2 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>d</mi></math> to the left of Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>, and the other particle has charge <math alttext="negative q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>-</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> and is a distance <math alttext="3 d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mi>d</mi></math> to the right of Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>. If the positive direction is taken to be toward the right, what is the net electric field at Point <math alttext="P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction 7 over 18, end fraction, times k times, the fraction q over d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative fraction 7 over 18, end fraction, times k times, the fraction q over d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mpadded><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac></mpadded><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 11 over 18, end fraction, times k times, the fraction q over d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>11</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative fraction 11 over 18, end fraction, times k times, the fraction q over d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mpadded><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mn>11</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mrow></mpadded></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 11 over 18, end fraction, times k times, the fraction q over d squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mn>11</mn><mn>18</mn></mfrac><mi>k</mi><mfrac><mi>q</mi><msup><mi>d</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
